step.cmd: Turn on teacher and student workstations. Student workstation can be turned on remotely from the teacher workstation if they have been set up to do so (see _fixme_ xref).
Launch the teacher module and student modules if they have not been already launched upon Windows startup.
Login to your account in the teacher module. For a new teacher, log in as Admin and add a teacher account (section ).

Open a class file. If this is a new class, select ClassNew from the main menu, and enter number of students in the class and number of rows in the virtual classroom. You can also (re)arrange student seats manually and edit the class list. Save the class file on the teacher workstation (section ).
Perform student roll call registration (section ). Correct student names if necessary.
You can now arrange students into groups (section ) and assign them activities (section ).

The process of finishing a lesson depend on the types of the activities performed during the session. For example, after a self access activity it might be necessary to collect classroom assignments (section ).
You can copy lesson materials between the teacher folder and removable media using standard Windows tools.
Student workstation can be shut down remotely from the teacher module (section ).
Exit the teacher module and shut down the teacher workstation (if necessary).
